author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Tuesday flagged off 109 new buses and 40 small buses worth Rs. 29 crore. She also inaugurated three bus depots set up at a cost of Rs. 2.90 crore.

A total of 4,044 tenements constructed by the Tamil Nadu Slum Clearance Board at a total cost of Rs. 272 crore in Chennai, Kancheepuram, Coimbatore and Erode districts were also inaugurated.

“During the last five years, 60,595 tenements have been constructed by the Board at a cost of Rs. 2,683 crore and works have commenced to construct an additional 34,013 tenements at Rs. 1,411 crore,” an official release stated.

The Chief Minister also inaugurated various buildings for the Tamil Development and Information Department at a cost of Rs. 25 crore. A memorial for freedom fighter Ondiveeran at a cost of Rs. 64 lakh in Palayamkottai was unveiled by the Chief Minister.

She also inaugurated the Amma Master Health Check up scheme for women in Government General Hospital in Chennai at a cost of Rs. 10 crore. Ms. Jayalalithaa also inaugurated buildings worth Rs. 207 crore and laid the foundation stone for various hospitals across the State to be constructed at Rs. 458 crore.

For the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department, the Chief Minister inaugurated buildings constructed at a cost of Rs. 41 crore.

Various buildings constructed for the Municipal Administration and Water Supply Department constructed at a cost of Rs. 735 crore were also inauguared by the Chief Minister, who also laid the foundation stone for new buildings and schemes worth Rs. 22.33 lakh for the department.
title: New projects inaugurated
